title: Effects of attributions and confirmation bias

content.description:
Jose and Maggie are discussing the results of their recent chemistry exam.
Jose: I got a 97% on the test.
Maggie: Congratulations! I did well, too – I got a 95%! I wonder how Brayden did on the test.
Jose: I heard he got a 53% on it, but he had like three tests that day.
Maggie: Well, he’s not the smartest student in our grade. I’m not surprised he got a low score.
content.question: Given the information in this scenario, which of the following future behaviors from Brayden will Maggie be most likely to remember?

choices.label: Brayden does well on his next chemistry test.
Brayden does well on an exam in a different class.
Brayden slips on the ice walking to class.
Brayden helps a classmate find a room on campus.

content.answer: Brayden slips on the ice walking to class.

skill.text: 1.B: Explain how cultural norms, expectations, and circumstances, as well as cognitive biases apply to behavior and mental processes.
